RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.
Two Nomai debated about some sort of safety test while waiting outside this tower to travel to something called the Deep Storm Station.
The Nomai investigated some sort of issue at a tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.
The Deep Storm Station used energy from the electric core of Giant's Deep to test the mechanisms of the Ash Twin Project's negative time interval.
Nomai traveled to a new warp pad on Giant's Deep to enter the Deep Storm Station.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles column formations.
The Nomai investigated some sort of issue at a tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles column formations.
Two Nomai children waited inside this tower for something called the sunless day to play some sort of game.
The secret to the children's game was to wait for the sunless day.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.
The Nomai investigated some sort of issue at a tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.
The Nomai kept the rotating doors of this tower closed to keep native life from Timber Hearth transported there from wandering any farther without protection and oxygen.
Rotating doors are controlled by sight through vision orbs.
A Nomai named Oeno noticed this tower's rotating doors opening and closing by themself, even in the absence of any Nomai.
A Nomai named Yarrow suggested traveling to the solar towers on Ash Twin's poles to investigate if the vision orbs there experienced the same issue.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.
The Nomai investigated some sort of issue at a tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.
I found a scroll containing Oeno's report on why the doors on Ash Twin were activating without input.
The Hourglass Twins feel a constant pull of gravity from each other.
A sunless day occurs when the Hourglass Twins orbit into direct alignment with the sun, causing a combined force of gravity from the sun and gravity from the twin closer to the sun.
These combined gravitational forces pull on anything in its path, including the vision orbs powering the doors.
The sunless day is the cause of the sand funnel between the Hourglass Twins.

RumorFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.
The Nomai investigated some sort of issue at a tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.

ExploreFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.

RumorFact.Text: The Nomai traveled to the solar towers on Ash Twin's poles to investigate if their vision orbs were experiencing similar issues.
Chert suggests exploring the Hourglass Twins' poles to be safe from the column of sand.

ExploreFact.Text: Towers installed with colossal solar panels constructed at both of Ash Twin's poles.
The Nomai did not observe issues with the solar towers' vision orbs. They planned to investigate the issue further at the other tower on Ash Twin with rotating doors.
The solar towers on Ash Twin were built on the planet's poles to avoid something called the sunless day.
The sand funnel between the Hourglass Twins follows the sunless day.
The Nomai discussed plans to relocate the solar panels on Ember Twin, due to issues with its current site.
